title: (x) Times New Roman-like font on "Tah Hsin Industrial Corp." business card {Max I. Mus}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111223160140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BusinessCard0001_3865.jpg)
  
My other half showed me this business card from ]her travels.  
I was really into.  
So came upstairs to scan and post on the I.D board  
Now I can see it close up it looks like times  
is not though is it?

Mr Brown
author: Mr Brown

comments.content: It's not Times. The name looks like [Linotype Excelsior](http://web.archive.org/web/20111223160140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/excelsior/), slightly condensed, but the "g" is wrong. The rest looks like some form of Bookman, perhaps [Bookman Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20111223160140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bookman-old-style/).

\> Please tell me its not Times New Roman

It’s not Times New Roman.

Adobe Serif substitution font perhaps?

- Lex
i agree with lex... and at a guess, it is probably trying to imitate bookman

The name and title seems to be Georgia,

The info at the bottom is Bookman Old Style

the TAH HSIN etc. I don't know.
I should have recognized Georgia, but I'm not used to seeing it off screen, especially not on stationary.
The "TAH HSIN..." line is actually Times Roman, squooshed a bit.

\> The “TAH HSIN…” line is actually Times Roman.

Nope. Serifs of the S are angled here. Not so in Times.

I'm guessing it is the roman part of a chinese font. That would mean it was probably created by either

[http://www.arphic.com.tw/usa/fontGallery/fontLists/big5-01.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20111223160140/http:/www.arphic.com.tw/usa/fontGallery/fontLists/big5-01.htm "http://www.arphic.com.tw/usa/fontGallery/fontLists/big5-01.htm")

or

[http://www.dynalab.com/DesktopDefault.aspx?TabId=4714](http://web.archive.org/web/20111223160140/http:/www.dynalab.com/DesktopDefault.aspx?TabId=4714 "http://www.dynalab.com/DesktopDefault.aspx?TabId=4714")

Wow thanks.  
I'm glad its not Times.  
I think its what typical said:  
a western / roman version of a Chinese typeface.  
LiSong Pro on my Mac system is not exactly the same but  
has the same if not better feel.

Thanks to all of you who posted

\*
